definition: "cover" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 14), occurring in 軍|军[jun1], 冠[guan1] etc, known as 禿寶蓋|秃宝盖[tu1 bao3 gai4] or 平寶蓋|平宝盖[ping2 bao3 gai4]
to fill in a form/to write data in a box (on a questionnaire or web form)

sentences.english: Or writing a fantastic story, painting or sculpting.
sentences.chinese: 或写一个不错的故事，绘画或雕像。

sentences.english: Most of the scenes are written in verse, but some are in prose.
sentences.chinese: 她所写的诗大部分都是无韵诗。

sentences.english: There was a long time when he wrote his own music without saying one word.
sentences.chinese: 有好长一段时间他写自己的音乐，一声也不吭。

sentences.english: Wanting to do him dirt, she sent his wife a poison-pen letter.
sentences.chinese: 施诡计就写了一封恶意中伤的信给他的妻子。

sentences.english: The book treats the problem too sketchily.
sentences.chinese: 该书关于这一问题写得太简略。

sentences.english: The shooting script was actually based on two scripts (written separately by Welles and Mankiewicz) that Welles combined into one for the final version.
sentences.chinese: 威尔斯最终用的是他和曼凯维支写的剧本的混编版。

sentences.english: Mr. Anderson was writing a book on the history of Denmark.
sentences.chinese: 安得森先生正在写一本关于丹麦历史的书。

sentences.english: The only thing one can write that is a bit serious—a love letter.
sentences.chinese: 唯一我们能够写的就是一板正经的情书。

sentences.english: I have also written a good essay, essay competitions among the best.
sentences.chinese: 我作文也写的很好，征文比赛名列前茅。

sentences.english: Write her a short love letter.
or read to him some of my own writings and been rewarded in return with praise unsparing.
sentences.chinese: 或者给他读些我写的作品，都得到了他极大的赞赏。

sentences.english: One woman said she had scribbled "California" on her paper.
sentences.chinese: 一个女人说她在纸上草草写了“加州”这个词。

sentences.english: As it is I have been forced into becoming a sort of pamphleteer.
sentences.chinese: 事实是，我被迫成了一名写小册子的作家。

sentences.english: A beautiful ballad written by Hins Cheung.
sentences.chinese: 这是张敬轩写的一首很优美动听的歌曲。

sentences.english: Say, read the book you see smoke on the fetal well, easy to teratogenicity .
sentences.chinese: 就说你看到书上写着抽烟对胎儿不好，容易致畸。

sentences.english: Suddenly I had the idea of writing a message in a bottle.
sentences.chinese: “我突然冒出了写一封“瓶中信”的念头。

definition: to write without lifting one's pen from the paper/(in the Romanization of Chinese) to write two or more syllables together as a single word (not separated by spaces)
to take up one's pen/to start to write
impression of a book/opinion expressed in a book review
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
style of writing (literary style)/way of writing a character/spelling
